heroAnswers

Class EnhancedHuman

  • java.lang.Object
    • heroAnswers.SuperHero
      • heroAnswers.EnhancedHuman
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Hero

    public class EnhancedHuman
extends SuperHero
    An "enhanced" human is born as a mere mortal (e.g., Billy Batson) but later gains the ability to turn into a superhero (e.g., Captain Marvel) through some magical or science fiction plot device (e.g., by saying the name of the wizard "Shazam"). Therefore, when an enhanced human switches into their secret (super) identity they also acquire a whole collection of superpowers, and lose them again when changing back to their real (non-super) identity.
    Author:
    n5372828 - Ian Daniel

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      EnhancedHuman(java.lang.String normalIdentity, java.lang.String enhancedIdentity, SuperPower[] acquiredPowers)
      A superhero of the "enhanced human" variety begins life with no superpowers and a mortal identity, but also has an "enhanced" (super) identity, in which he/she acquires several superpowers.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods

      Tests to see whether or not the superhero currently has the queried superpower.
      void switchIdentity()
      Switches the hero's current identity to their alter ego.
      int totalPower()
      Returns the superhero's current "total power" which is the sum of the numerical values associated with all of their currently held powers.

      • EnhancedHuman

        public EnhancedHuman(java.lang.String normalIdentity,
                     java.lang.String enhancedIdentity,
                     SuperPower[] acquiredPowers)
        A superhero of the "enhanced human" variety begins life with no superpowers and a mortal identity, but also has an "enhanced" (super) identity, in which he/she acquires several superpowers.
        Parameters:
        normalIdentity - - the superhero's initial, mortal identity
        enhancedIdentity - - the superhero's "enhanced" identity, when transformed
        acquiredPowers - - the superpowers the hero acquires when in his/her "enhanced" identity

      • switchIdentity

        public void switchIdentity()
        Switches the hero's current identity to their alter ego. When a hero changes to their "super" identity they gain all of their powers. When they switch back to their normal identity they lose them again.
        Specified by:
        switchIdentity in interface Hero
        Overrides:
        switchIdentity in class SuperHero
